meanings.sent1: The seigniors in the castle were respected by all.
meanings.sent2: The seigniors attended the royal banquet.
meanings.sent3: The seigniors decided to have a jousting tournament for fun.
meanings.sent4: The seigniors ruled over their lands like kings.
meanings.sent5: The image of the seigniors in their grand attire was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A man of rank or authority.
meanings.sent1: The wise seigniors of the council made important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The seigniors of the town welcomed the visiting dignitaries.
meanings.sent3: The seigniors played a game of chess to determine who was the most authoritative.
meanings.sent4: His presence in the room commanded respect, like that of a seignior.
meanings.sent5: The seigniors' words carried weight in the community.

meanings.definition: A person who holds a position of power or influence.
meanings.sent1: The business seigniors negotiated the merger successfully.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the seignior of the fashion industry.
meanings.sent3: The seigniors organized a charity event to show their influence.
meanings.sent4: Her charisma made her a seignior among her peers.
meanings.sent5: The seigniors' decisions shaped the future of the company.
